intro: Copaifera arenicola, commonly known as the arenicola copaifera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil and is characterized by its small, compound leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant is typically found in sandy soils and is adapted to coastal environments. It produces small, woody pods that contain several seeds. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
